#Text=CanadaVOTES : Animal Alliance ( AAEVPC ) party leader Liz White running in Toronto
#Text=Centre
#Text=Wednesday , October 1 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=Animal Alliance Environment Voters Party of Canada
#Text=leader Liz White
#Text=is standing for election in the riding of Toronto Centre .
#Text=Once the director of the Toronto Humane Society , she has been with the Animal Alliance Canada organization since the 1980s .
#Text=She is currently a full time staff member and Director , working on legislative and media matters , as well as fundraising .
#Text=According to her biography on their website ,
#Text=" her primary issues include Municipal Animal Control by-law matters , endangered species legislation and hunting issues .

#Text=The Animal Alliance Environment Voters Party of Canada was formed because of a Supreme Court ruling which prevented  third parties " ( not registered political parties ) from speaking out effectively at election time .

column1: #Text=Prior to the ruling , Animal Alliance 's political arm Environment Voters participated as a third party in federal , provincial and municipal election campaigns .
#Text=After the ruling , the only way we could participate effectively within the law was to become a federally registered political party which we did .

#Text=The Animal Alliance Environment Voters Party of Canada was formed to bring forward the principle of just and equitable human progress that respects , protects and enhances the environment upon which we all depend and the lives of the animals with whom we share our world .
#Text=I am running in Toronto Centre because I live there and because there are significant environmental and animal protection issues to be addressed .
#Text=The Don River , a significant watershed runs parallel to the riding .
#Text=The re-naturalization of the Don River lands has progressed but the river remains a source of pollution which affects wildlife and the environment .
#Text=My riding also touches the lake and we have been promoting the re-naturalization of the shoreline , an important ecological initiative .

#Text=My riding is close to Tommy Thompson Park which hosts a large and ecologically significant waterbird colony with Black-crown Night Herons , Double-crested Cormorants and colony of 30,000 gulls .
#Text=We have an active campaign to defend cormorants , Canada geese and other birds against government sponsored culls .
#Text=Finally , consideration is being given to the removal of the Gardiner Expressway and the re-naturalization of the lands below the off and on ramps .

#Text=My riding presents significant opportunities to reclaim biological diversity , create wildlife corridors , to address and prevent human wildlife conflict and to re-naturalize habitat long lost to industrial use .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=I have been involved in politics , advocating for the environment for over 30 years and for animals for over 20 years .

#Text=In addition , I volunteered as a board member to a legal clinic specializing in poverty law and as a co-chair for a non-profit group that raised money and advocated for a native community in northern Alberta .
#Text=My experience positions me to fulfill our mandate which is to fight for a just and equitable society that respects and protects humans , animals and the environment .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=My approach to campaigning is to highlight and discuss the plight of the environment and the animals with whom we share the planet .
#Text=So the voters tend not to ask my position on other issues .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=Yes , the misconceptions is that we are referred to as a fringe party .
#Text=Nothing could be further from the truth .
#Text=We are the party of new ideas , a party of vision .
#Text=Granting women the right to vote was considered a radical initiative as expressed in the article “ Human Rights in Canada , A Historical Perspective ” :
#Text=“ The men in control of the country perceived women as a ‘ weaker sex ’ needing protection and guidance .
#Text=Some believed allowing women to vote would only unsettle them and lead to family discord . ” [ 1 ]
#Text=However , with political pressure brought about by women of the time , the laws changed .
#Text=Again as the article describes , “ Times are about to change .

#Text=A generation of women – led by dynamos like Nellie McClung , Emily Murphy , Ada Powers , Josephine Dandurand and Elizabeth Smith Shortt – have lobbied , cajoled , heckled , and ridiculed politicians for denying them their rights .
#Text=They collected petitions , held rallies , and fought to have their voices heard . ”

#Text=The Animal Alliance Environment Voters Party of Canada raises issues about the environment and animal protection that other parties fail to discuss either in elections or during the legislative agenda .
#Text=We are the Nellie McClungs of the environmental and animal protection world .
#Text=There are more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=We have our television ad on YouTube ; however , I do not know how to measure the effectiveness other than it provides much broader access .
#Text=It is hard to tell how many voters in my particular riding are accessing the ad .
#Text=↑
#Text=http://www.chrc-ccdp.ca/en/timePortals/milestones/13mile.asp
